subject: p18828251
History: -year-old male with history of heart failure, now with renal failure, evaluate for pulmonary edema.
Findings: There is no pneumothorax or definite pleural effusion. There is no focal airspace consolidation. The lung volumes are low. There is mild prominence of the pulmonary vasculature, albeit less than prior exam. Despite technique, the heart size is enlarged, but unchanged from prior. Sternotomy wires and CABG clips are noted. Small granulomas are again seen in the right lung base.
